Legal_Issue: Whether the Applicant met the residency requirement under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant was physically present in Canada for 691 days within the four years preceding application; maintained strong ties to Canada including family, property, and frequent returns
Court_Ruling: Citizenship Judge made factual errors and misapplied the Re Koo centralized mode of existence test
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge denied application based on perceived residency shortfall and insufficient evidence of Canadian ties
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous finding of failure to meet 1,095-day residency requirement; misapplication of legal test
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness for factual and legal issues; correctness for procedural fairness
Assessment_Factor: Centralized mode of existence test from Re Koo; comparison of applicant's connections to Canada versus other countries
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review in Federal Court following administrative decision
Application_Basis: Residency duration and quality of ties to Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Strength and consistency of Canadian connections relative to foreign connections
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and referral back for re-determination
Governing_Rule: Re Koo centralized mode of existence test
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure by Citizenship Judge to properly assess comparative strength of ties to Canada vs. other countries
Outcome: Case remanded to another Citizenship Judge for re-determination
Harm_Assessment: Unjust denial of citizenship due to legal and factual errors
Cause_Description: Denial of citizenship due to perceived residency shortfalls and insufficient evidence of Canadian ties
Evidence_Handling: Incomplete and erroneous evaluation of residency and connection evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act (alleged violation, later found not established due to error)
Evidence_Issues: Misinterpretation of residency patterns and weight given to ties
Residency_Compliance: Alleged non-compliance with 1,095-day requirement; physical presence 691 days but contextual factors considered
Evidence_Assessment: Judge failed to conduct proper comparative analysis under Re Koo test
Decision_Rationale: Significant factual errors and misapplication of law necessitate re-hearing
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient reasoning in evaluating strength of Canadian ties compared to foreign ties
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to factual findings; correctness for procedural fairness
